snippet: Two researchers say they have found drawings by the young Caravaggio and have made their findings public in two e-books for sale on Amazon.com. But some art historians and Italian officials have expressed doubt.
abstract: Researchers Maurizio Bernardelli Curuz and Adriana Conconi Fedrigolli say they have discovered 100 drawings by Caravaggio among a collection of drawings in a castle in Milan; they have published their findings in two e-books available on Amazon.com and a Web site, but scholars and officials have cast doubt on the drawings' attribution and researchers' credibility.

byline.contributor: Carol Vogel contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Two researchers say they have found drawings by the young Caravaggio and have made their findings public in two e-books for sale on Amazon.com. But some art historians and Italian officials have expressed doubt.

headline.seo: Drawings Said to Be Caravaggio’s Raise Doubts
